abstract: The report, using census data, found that immigrant households on the island made an annual income not far behind that of American-born families.
snippet: The report, using census data, found that immigrant households on the island made an annual income not far behind that of American-born families.
lead_paragraph: Immigrants, those who are here legally and illegally, are important contributors to the economy on Long Island and are a relatively affluent group, according to a report to be released on Thursday.

headline.main: Study Finds That Immigrants Are Central to Long Island Economy
